fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

As of now, Parent Status Validator is only for for Subtask to Parent Task (ie Story, Bug etc). By the introduction of Parent Link custom field of Portfolio, it's now possible to link between Story-Epic, Epic-Initiative etc. It would be great to extend this feature to other issue types too.
h3. Suggested Resoution

Allow Parent Status Validator for Story to Epic link (other issue types)
fields.summary: Allow Parent Status Validator for Story to Epic link

fields.description: The Jira - Slack integration should allow for more complex filtering, like sending notifications to different Slack channels based on some issue fields, like _Component_. Also, a JQL filter for notifications to be sent in a channel would be nice.
fields.summary: provide the ability to filter Jira Slack notifications based on custom field value

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When there are multiple fields with the same name (ie Team), Field Required Validator only shows the one that was added recently. This prevents user to use the correct custom field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have Jira Portfolio and Tempo installed. Each of this add-ons has "Team" custom field.
# Below is the current result of all Team fields from DB:
||id||cfname||description||
|10024 |Team |Tempo Team Custom Field |
|13900 |Team | |
|15400 |Team |Tempo Team Custom Field |
# Add Fields required Validator to any workflow transition.
# Depending which field that has the bigger ID, it will be shown. In this example, Team field from Tempo will be shown in the list of fields in Workflow validator and when the user wanna add Team from Jira Portfolio, it's not possible.
# Create another custom field called Team
||id||cfname||description||
|10024 |Team |Tempo Team Custom Field |
|13900 |Team | |
|15400 |Team |Tempo Team Custom Field |
|15831 |Team |This is Testing |
# Now, the Team field that is being shown is the newly created custom field (Not Tempo nor Porfolio)
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Result

Only the latest added field will be shown.

h3. Expected Result

All fields should be shown.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Field Required Validator doesn't show all fields with the same name

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When a new user goes through the Jira onboarding and selects the option that they have no experience with Jira, a first ticket is created to introduce the user to the template. The link for "introduction to Scrum" is broken.

h2. How to reproduce
# Onboard as a new Jira user
# Select the option which suggests you're new to Jira
# A new issue is automatically created introducing the user to Jira
# Click the link "Introduction to Scrum"
 !Screenshot_260.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected behaviour
The link opens a page with a relevant introduction to Scrum.

h3. Actual results
404 page is returned

h2. Workaround
Use the link https://www.scrumalliance.org/community/articles/2013/november/an-introduction-to-scrum
fields.summary: Introduction to Scrum link for new Jira users broken

fields.description:
Currently the Jira Attachment Import logic works as follows

# Upload the attachments zip.
# Zip file gets processed
# A confirmation screen is presented
# Once you click proceed, 
# The final stage begins and you are presented with a task ID. 

This process is quite flaky in the sense that it relies on the end user having an active internet connection till you get to step number 3. Logically the attachment import should be asynchronous after the upload is complete.
fields.summary: Change attachment upload and processing logic.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Permission Helper doesn't display if a user doesn't have application access to a specific product, which can be misleading to admins as they might think that a certain user should be able to access a project, for instance.

h3. Suggested Solution

Display a Warning in the Permission Helper to alert that the user doesn't have application access to a product.

h3. Why this is important
 
Better UX for users. Easier troubleshooting to understand why a user can't access a project and other permission-related issues for admins.
fields.summary: Display if a user doesn't have application access in the Permission Helper

fields.description:

It looks like the fields appear dynamically based on the previous fields selection type, and this is something which would be incredibly useful for our system.

You will see only one field visible initially, then when you have completed that, the next fields show up ( I assume dependant on what option you selected in the previous field)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new "Issue detail view" does not open the dialog box when creating a sub-task

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the appropriate board
# Select an issue and hit to create a sub-task, it will create as inline create issue

h3. Expected Results
* Should open dialog box instead of the inline create issue

h3. Actual Results
* Create sub-task is through inline create issue, missing sub-task fields that are created from project admin to meet their project goals

* Navigate to your profile(https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa) and disable "Issue detail view"; this is a per-user setting(each end user will need to make this change themselves)

fields.description: We have a dashboard page, which is restricted to read only for certain user group. We would like to monitor and determine the number of time the page is accessed and by who.

 !yejht.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

 !_KAN-19____67_6_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

When creating an issue, the Create screen is updated dynamically to reflect the Screen scheme of the selected issue type. This is not the case with the Edit Screens.
Furthermore, due to the context is not updated dynamically, it has exposed to potential to bypass a required field. 
 
h3. Step to reproduce:
# Create a separate screen (eg, bug screen) to be associated with the screen scheme
# Create a custom field (Eg, important field)
# Configure the custom field to only apply to bug issue type
# Set this custom field *required* in the field configuration
# Only associate this custom field with the Bug Screen
# Associate this screen to the issue type screen scheme for issue type Bug
# Create an issue as Story
# Change the issue's issue type value to bug 

(i) Note both issue type configured should share the same workflow for this to work

h3. Expected result:
- The Edit screen form should be updated dynamically to display the Screen associated (Bug Screen) when changing issue type
- Then the custom field showed up as required
OR
- Jira detects there is a required field on different issue type, not allowing to edit the issue type (Similar to how it works for issue type with different workflow)

h3. Actual result:
We can update the issue type from the Edit screen form if they were using same workflow, hence effectively *bypassing the need to fill in the required field* allowing Bug issue without the required value in the custom field.

The required custom field will only show up in the edit screen once the update button is clicked and click on the edit again, where the edit screen switched the context to Bug issue type. 

Issue Type Screen Scheme:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-13 at 16.39.43.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-09-13 at 16.40.42.png|thumbnail!  
Story Edit Screen:
!Screen Shot 2018-09-13 at 16.41.29.png|thumbnail! 
Selecting Bug as the new issue type but no change on the Edit form:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-13 at 16.41.37.png|thumbnail! 
After the Update, we have access to the Bug Edit Screen but we have to edit a 2nd time:
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-13 at 16.41.51.png|thumbnail! 

Changing the issue type value via the Edit screen can result in discrepancies if fields are different, required or if contexts are defined for an issue types that we can update to via the Edit screen. For example, updating an existing Task to a Bug can result in a Bug created without its specificities (required fields, context). We have to go through the Edit Screen a 2nd time to see the expected Edit Screen form defined by the Issue Type Screen Scheme. 

h3. Workaround:
Use inline editing to change the issue's type from the View issue screen and instead of the Edit screen forms.
fields.summary: Changing the issue type in the edit issue dialog doesn't update the form and fields according to the new issue type's screen dynamically

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Post Functions placed after the "Creates the issue originally." event will not persist in the database and this is not clarified or restricted within JIRA.
- Previous bug ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33182

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Edit the project's workflow
# Add the "Update Issue Field" post function to the "Create Issue" transition
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Set the function to update (Resolution) to a specific value
# Create the issue

h3. Expected results
The issue is created with the Resolution specified in the post function.

h3. Actual results
The issue is created without the change that's specified in the post function.

h3. Notes
* The workaround posted at [Post-function on Create Issue transition appears to not work|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Post-function+on+Create+Issue+transition+appears+to+not+work] doesn't work.
fields.summary: Update Issue Field post function for Resolution field doesn't fire when set for Create Issue transition

fields.description:
With the introduction of the unified profile for the Cloud products, there's is an option to change the *nickname* for a user and this will be used in products like Stride and Confluence, so the user can be mentioned through the configured nickname. In Jira, although the nickname has changed, the same is not used in Jira for the mention. Only the email, previously configured username and full name will be used. 

This is a request to allow Jira to use the nickname from the unified profile for the mentions.
fields.summary: Nickname from Profile to be Used in Mentions

fields.description:
h3. ‌Problem Definition
Referring to the [REST API Reference|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/], the *Create Project* endpoint ({{POST /rest/api/3/project}}) currently requires the user to provide a Project Key.

By not providing a Project Key in the {{Body Parameters}}, the REST call will fail, as the Project Key is required.
{code}
"projectKey":"Project keys must start with an uppercase letter, followed by one or more uppercase alphanumeric characters."
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
If the REST call does not contain a Project Key, Jira should automatically generate one, similar to when creating a project through the UI.

h3. Why this is important
This helps to make the Project Creation process more standardized. Through the UI, a project key will be automatically generated, however, through the REST endpoint, users will not have the same experience.
fields.summary: Provide the option to automatically generate the Project Key when creating a Project using REST API

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your language as a different language than English
# Create a custom field(ex. "Note) and associate it to a certain screen
# In https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa, click the three dots for that field and select "Translate" and add some translation(ex. "注意")
# Navigate to a screen with the custom field associated
# Change the value for that custom field

h3. Expected Results
"注意" is shown both in the issue view and the activity section

h3. Actual Results
"注意" is shown only in the issue view and it remains as "Note" in the activity section

h3. Note
This is fixed in the new issue view.
fields.summary: Show the translated version of custom field in the history tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira mobile app notification option unavailable for boards with JQL containing operator.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a Scrum board in a desktop browser.
# Set the board to use a saved filter with JQL similar to below:
{noformat}
project = ABC AND fixVersion is not EMPTY
{noformat}
(i) Edit the query to match the project that exists.
# Access the board via Jira mobile app and check for *Notifications* option.
#* There isn't an option to enable notification for that particular board.
# Alter the JQL and remove the "AND fixVersion is not EMPTY" clause and save it.
# Try to access the board again for the notification option in Jira mobile app.

h3. Note

* This affects both iOS and Android based Jira mobile apps.

h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira mobile app notification option unavailable for board with JQL containing operator

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Custom field Select List (single choice) and Select List (multiple choices) freeze and take a long time to select the option when it has many options when using the new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field Custom field Select List (single choice) or Select List (multiple choices) and add 4k or more options.
# Add the field to the desired screen.
# Select the desired options.

h3. Expected Results

The options are selected and saved normally as the old issue view.

The field freezes and it takes almost a minute for the option to be selected.

On the new issue view, it's also not possible to select many options when pressing CTRL.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* On Chrome 69.0.X, screen elements are not extending past the page boundary
* The issue only appears on issues that doesn't have much content i.e. short page length

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Chrome 69.0.X
# Navigate to Jira, start writing a new comment and click "Style"

h3. Expected Results
* All menu options should appear
* From Safari:
!Screen Shot 2018-09-12 at 16.46.51.png|thumbnail! 
* From Chrome 68.X
 !ChromeVersion68.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* From Chrome 69.0.X
* The menu is cut off and "Block quotes" isn't appearing
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-12 at 5.31.26 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* This isn't a problem on all other supported browsers including Chrome 68.X
* If the page is long enough, then this issue doesn't appear - the issue only appears if the  page isn't long enough to accommodate the entire menu

h3.Workaround
* For comments: Click and drag the bottom right-hand corner comment box
 !comment_style_chrome69.2018-09-12 17_42_09.gif!
fields.summary: Chrome 69.0.X doesn't allow elements to display past the  page boundary

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user adds a group to the default groups of a project role, and then deletes the group, the group will still remain in the default groups for the project role 

 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Group
# Add this group as default to and Role on the Project Role Browser screen
# Go back to User management / Groups and delete created above Group
# Go to Project Role Browser screen and check default members for the Role

h3. Expected Results
If the group is deleted from user management it should also be deleted from default groups in project role browser

h3. Actual Results 
The group name still stays in the Default Groups settings of the Project Role

h3. Notes
If user creates new project, this group will still be added to the project via the defualt project role setting

h3.Workaround (If there is no workaround directly say so)

You can manually remove the groups from the Defualt Groups screen for the project role
fields.summary: Group is not removed from Project Role default groups when deleted

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Reorganizing the statusses under Jira Setting -> Issues -> Statuses affects JQL queries using the "change from ... to ..." syntax. This appears to be a result of the independent projects having a scope set to "P" and thus when the visible status is moved below these in the sequence the JQL no longer returns theexpected values.

This will affect searches and filters for boards as reordering might affect results.
h3. Environment

NA
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Software project
# Create an issue within the project
# Transition the issue to "In Progress" and then to "Done"
# Create an independant project
# Execute the following JQL:
{code:java}
status changed from "Done" to "In Progress"
{code}
# Observation: The issue created in step 2 should appear in the results
# Navigate to Jira Setting -> Issues -> Statuses
# Move the order of the "Done" status down to the bottom of the list
# Re-execute the same JQL:
{code:java}
status changed from "Done" to "In Progress"
{code}
# Observation: The issues no longer appears in the results.

h3. Expected Results

The issue should appear in the results irrelevant of the status order.
h3. Actual Results

Issues not being returned as expected.
h3. Notes

Reviewing the "issuestatus" table in the database shows the sequence of the status and the JQL works as expected while the "Done" status that does not have a scope set is above the "Done" status for independent projects:
||id||sequence||pname||description||iconurl||statuscategory||created||updated||scope||project_configuration_id||
|10001|34|Done| |/|3|2018-05-03T09:13:00.506203Z|2018-09-11T23:10:08.705061Z| | |
|10044|35|Done| |/|3|2018-08-06T11:36:00.459609Z|2018-09-11T23:10:08.705061Z|P|10005|
 
h3. Workaround
Move the "Done" status higher up the order in statuses.
fields.summary: Reorganizing the status order affects JQL queries using the "change from ... to ..." syntax

fields.description:
So in Jira Cloud, you can link issues to a Confluence page:

!image-2018-09-12-14-15-52-607.png|width=417,height=293!

But it only works if you provide the full URL (e.g. [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~jblack/overview] ), not the Tiny Link URL (e.g. [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/x/ieJgD] ).

Would you be able to make linking work with Tiny Links as well as full links?

fields.summary: Can't link to Confluence pages via Tiny Link

fields.description:

* Currently, to relate to pieces of code in Jira you need to use the *code* string between curly brackets. 

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Why this is important

h3. Workaround 
use the *code* string between curly brackets.

!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* When managing subscriptions to a channel, I can add the project that I select from drop down list. 
* If I want to add all projects, I need to add manually one by one.
* The project drop down also requires a refresh after manually adding each project, which adds even more steps to the procedure

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a possibility to bulk add all projects.

h3. Workaround 
Currently, there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Bulk add projects to a Slack channel using the Jira Cloud bot

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the New "full detail" Jira issue view, users lost the ability to manage watchers.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for users to manage watchers while viewing the issue in the "full detail" view.

Previous "full detail" issue view:
 !Watchers old.png|thumbnail! 

New "full detail" issue view:
 !Watchers new.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
This should enhance greatly the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
You can temporarily disable the New Jira issue view in Business projects by clicking "See the old view" (on the top right corner of the screen).
 !New issue view.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As an user I'd like to manage watchers as I could before (New Jira issue view)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing the post functions in the workflow editor, editing an existing WebHook trigger event will bring up the WebHook selector. The selector will always have the first option in the selector selected instead of the currently applied WebHook. This Creates confusion for users that are attempting to confirm the value was correctly set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a post function to a workflow with a custom WebHook.
# save the workflow
# Edit the workflow again and edit the post function in-place

h3. Expected Results

The currently applied WebHook is pre-selected in the WebHook selector

h3. Actual Results
The first entry in the list of available WebHooks is pre-selected
 

h3.Workaround
Use the display prior to editing the WebHook to Confirm the setting.
fields.summary: Selector for Webhooks in post function editor does not pre-select the currently applied webhook

fields.description: I need to paste a table from Excel or Word into a comment. It doesn't work, it just converts to plain text. It MUST be a table that the person who is assigned to the issue can edit and add to.
fields.summary: Ability to paste and edit excel tables to the JIRA comments

 !Attachments sortable.png|thumbnail! 

New "full detail" issue view:

 !New issue view.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

If the language is set to *español (España)* in the personal settings, the option to browse files won't be available in any text field (system and custom fields):
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-11 at 13.37.54.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2018-09-11 at 13.38.25.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the profile icon -> *Personal settings*;
 # Change the language to *español (España)*;
 # Attempt to create or edit an issue. Notice that the *Browse files* option won't be displayed in neither system text fields, nor custom ones.

h3. Expected Results

The option to browse for files should appear.
h3. Actual Results

The option to browse for files won't be displayed.

h3. Observations

* The *Comments* field is not affected. If you add an attachment to the issue (in the issue view), the browse files option will return to the text fields in the edit screen as well;
* Issues that already have an attachment are not affected when switching the language.

h3. Workaround

So switching to English is an option. Attaching the wanted file after the issue creation is another one.
fields.summary: Browse files option not available in text fields  if the language is set to Spanish

fields.description: When looking at Time reporting, it would be best to be able to filter the time reports by various user properties such as their membership to a given project role would be useful information to separate time tracking information for a more useful set of information on how the team is spending their time.
fields.summary: Provide more filtering options for Time Reporting by role, properties, etc.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cannot change Jira language to English if the browser language is not English
h3. Environment
 * Google Chrome Browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set browser language to Dutch or Portuguese
 # Set Jira Language to English and set Personal Setting Language to Dutch or Portuguese
 # Try to change the language to English

h3. Expected Results
 * Jira instance is in English

h3. Actual Results
 * Jira instance follows browser language

h3. Workaround
 * Change the language in Personal Settings to Dutch or Portuguese
 * Save and Refresh the page
 * Change it back to English and Save
fields.summary: Cannot Change Jira Language To English If The Browser Language Is Not English

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the new issue view wiki renderer and using the special character ^ the resulting email notification will display this as :
{noformat}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. This feature, *support linking an external web link*, is currently rolled out to 100% of Jira cloud users, you will be able to see it in a drop-down menu next to "Link issues" in the action menu in the new issue view.


 !Screen Shot 2020-03-23 at 11.39.42 am.png|thumbnail! 


Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 11 Feb 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. We started the work on this feature, *support linking an external web link*, and aiming to roll it out in the next couple of weeks and it will include all the existing functionality that was on the old issue view. I know this has taken a while to build out, but rebuilding Jira issues is no small feat, so we very much appreciate your patience on this.

In the meantime, you can opt out of this new issue experience via your *Personal Settings* > *Jira Labs section* will have a 'new issue view' toggle to turn it on or off. We will not be disabling this opt-out option until we have rebuilt all the key features of the Jira issues experience you have come to know and love.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}




{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 9 Dec 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. We are planning to start the work on this feature, *support linking an external web link*, and aiming to roll it out in the next couple of months and it will include all the existing functionality that was on the old issue view. I know this has taken a while to build out, but rebuilding Jira issues is no small feat, so we very much appreciate your patience on this.

In the meantime, you can opt out of this new issue experience via your *Personal Settings* > *Jira Labs section* will have a 'new issue view' toggle to turn it on or off. We will not be disabling this opt-out option until we have rebuilt all the key features of the Jira issues experience you have come to know and love.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}

*Summary*

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The assign user list currently returns users with no application access. It checks the roles, groups and users associated to the permission but does not take in consideration of the application access. When attempting to assign the issue however, the ticket will not be assigned to the user with no application access however. So it mostly a bug with the user list.

h3. Investigation Done

The 2 JIRA REST end point below returns users with no application access as assignable users.

{noformat}
/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?username=valkyrie_191089&projectKeys=TSD&issueKey=TSD-16&maxResults=50&startAt=0
/rest/api/2/user/permission/search?username=valkyrie_191089&issueKey=TSD-16&permissions=ASSIGNABLE_USER
{noformat}

I think fixing the above end points will fix the bug.

Note : This problem also happens to the V3 REST end points specified [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-api-3-user-permission-search-get].

h3.Expected Results

The assignable user list should only return users with proper permission AND access.

h3.Current Results

The assignable user list returns users without application access.

h3.Workaround

One of our customers, Andrey,  has provided a workaround.

{quote}
As a workaround you can check if the user has the required application access via '/rest/api/2/user' and username= and expand=applicationRoles parameters and if there is an application access, then check the assignable permission with any of mentioned calls.
{quote}
fields.summary: Assignable user list returns users with no application access

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a user via rest api, the response does not contain the AccountID for the created user. see [Create User endpoint documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-api-3-user-post]


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a POST request to */rest/api/3/user* to create a user

h3. Expected Results

The response should contain the AccountID

{code}
{
  "self": "http://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user?username=mia",
  "key": "mia",
  "accountId": "99:27935d01-92a7-4687-8272-a9b8d3b2ae2e",
  "name": "mia",
  "emailAddress": "mia@example.com",
{code}

h3. Actual Results

The response does not contain the AccountID
{code}
{  
   "self":"https://try-ramon-portadmin.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user?username=charlie",
   "key":"charlie",
   "name":"charlie",
   "emailAddress":"charlie@atlassian.com",
{code}
 

h3.Workaround
Call the self endpoint from the create user response to retrieve the AccountID

{code}
{  
   "self":"https://try-ramon-portadmin.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user?username=charlie",
   "key":"charlie",
   "accountId":"55----------------------25fa",
   "name":"charlie",
   "emailAddress":"charlie@atlassian.com",
{code}
fields.summary: Create user REST API endpoint does not return the AccountID

fields.description:
h3. Description
* In the new issue view, adding URLs with invalid formatting to the Description field prevents changes from being saved, but *no errors are returned* in the UI.
* Sometimes, Jira automatically handles the special character and encodes the URL. When this does not happen, however, the problem can be observed

h3. How to reproduce
 # Open an issue
 # Edit the Description
 # Type a URL containing an invalid character (i.e. "*!*")
{quote}
https://testurl.com/thereis!aproblem
{quote}
 # Try saving the changes

h3. Expected results
 * An error is returned mentioning the problem, just as it is returned when trying add a comment
  !Screen Shot 2018-09-05 at 2.49.27 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results
 * No errors are returned in the UI, only in the browser's console:
  !Screen Shot 2018-09-05 at 2.46.37 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-09-05 at 2.47.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 

This prevents users from saving the changes made to the Description field and may cause confusion, as no errors are returned.
fields.summary: Adding a URL with invalid format in the Description field does not return errors

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Saving a filter does not create and save a filter column configuration. This is problematic for filters that are created for subscriptions as the filter owner is expecting that the columns configured will remain the same. Instead, the subscription will be based on the user's default column preference. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Do a JQL search
- Set the columns to Key, Assignee, Reporter
- Save the filter and check the *Filter* column configuration
-  !filter after save.png|thumbnail! 
- Open another filter and set a "My Default" column configuration to Key, Project
-  !My default.png|thumbnail! 
- Revisit the previously saved filter and open the *Filter* column settings. 

h3. Expected Results

The *Filter* column settings should indicate Key, Assignee, Reporter

h3. Actual Results

The *Filter* column uses the *My Default* settings (Key, Project)
 !Filter.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
When saving a filter make sure to click on *Done* under the *Filter* column configuration. This will save the filter column configuration.

 !Done after save.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Saving a filter does not create and save a filter column configuration

 !Map_Value.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Suggested Solution
Display a warning:-
{panel}
Resolution field value will import and map as it is. The resolution update will take affect for xxx issue. 
{panel}

h3. Why this is important
 The admin might miss to tick it , and all the resolution field will be stored with the wrong value.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Resolution field validation for CSV import

When uploading the attachment with a "@" symbol in the title, the attachment gets uploaded into the "Attachments" section of the issue view but if you try to include it within the comments, you will get an error " Unable to render embedded object: File not found. " 

 

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create an attachment with title containing "@" symbol, for example (test@test.png)
 # Upload or drag and drop the attachment in the issue view page
 # The attachment will be shown in the *Attachments* section of the issue view 
 # In the comment section itself the attachment will not render and show you an error. 

 

 

*Expected Results*

To be able to attach an image containing the special character "@"  

*Actual Results*

Not able to attach an image containing the special character "@"  

 
*Workaround*
Remove the "@" symbol from the title of the image and re-upload it again to the issue page, the picture will show properly in the comment section.

h3. Problem Definition
* When uploading a GIF file to the description or comment field, the size is not adapted to the screen. In other words, it does not decrease automatically proportionally to the size of the preview.
* Example 1: This is a small file. This is how I expect all files to show up: 
**   !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
* Example 2: As you can see through the yellow mark, I need to scroll to the right to see the full attachment. 
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Suggested Solution
* Automatically decrease the size of the file adapting to the screen. 

h3. Why this is important
* Have more interactive interface. 
 
h3. Workaround 
* Upload file with a smaller less pixels. 
* Change to the new issue view.
fields.summary: I want GIF file uploaded to description field to decrease size proportionally and adapt to the screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when creating a backup without attachments in Jira Backup Manager, user will be able to create another backup without attachments immediately, there's no timer. However, if the user wants to create a backup with attachments, it has the 48 hours timer, regardless of any type of backup created previously.

Have a separate timer that only starts counting when backup with attachments are created.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Atlassian Update, May 27th, 2019:*
Hello,

This issue is fixed. Now, if you go back to a project, the last accessed page of that project is opened.

Thanks,
Jira product management team
{panel}

h3. Summary

Upon opening a Jira project, you're automatically redirected to the last page you accessed in that project. However, accessing any page under 'Issues and Filters' breaks this feature, in a way what you're always redirected to the page previous to that access. 

Once that happens, the feature stops working until we access a board page (Backlog, Active Sprints, etc.). For example, this shows the page accessed and to what page you're returned upon closing the project and re-opening it:
# Backlog: backlog
# Components: components
# Pages: pages
# Versions: versions
# 'All my issues' (under 'Issue and Filters'): versions (last page before this one)
# Components: versions
# Pages: versions
# Backlog: backlog
# Components: components

Accessing 5 breaks the feature until we access 8.

This was tested in Software and Business projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and access a non-board page, like components
#* Noticed that closing the project and re-opening it redirects you to that page
# Open the project and access a page under 'Issues and Filters'
# Close project and re-open it

h3. Expected Results
You're redirected to the page you access under 'Issues and Filters'

h3. Actual Results
You're actually redirected to the previous page (say components) and this redirection persists even if you access other pages, unless that page is a board page, when this is reset.
 
h3. Notes
We can see in the database that the property 'last-visited-item.<project ID>'  remains with the previous value when accessing 'Issues and Filters'

h3.Workaround
Access a board page to reset this behaviour.
fields.summary: Accessing Issues and Filters page in project breaks last visited redirection

fields.description:
The example for the endpoint /rest/api/3/search in the Jira Cloud REST API documentation is incomplete:
- [Search for issues using JQL (GET)|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-api-3-search-get]

Indeed, the provided example is the below one:
{noformat}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/search' \
  --user 'email@example.com:<api_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{noformat}

However, the above example is missing to show the actual JQL query (url encoded) to be added after the *jql* parameter.

The example should be corrected and the JQL parameter should be added to the url. Something like (project = Test Project"):
{noformat}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/search?jql=project%20%3D%20"Test%20Project"' \
  --user 'email@example.com:<api_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{noformat}
fields.summary: The /rest/api/3/search endpoint example is missing the search parameter

fields.description:
The public documentation [Create a project in your new Jira experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/create-a-project-in-your-new-jira-experience-937886053.html] contains some outdated instructions about how to *Create projects using shared configuration*.

As described in the documentation, the steps to do so would be:
{quote}
# Choose the *Jira icon > Projects*.
# Select *Create project* (top right).
# Give your project a name.
# Under *Project template*, select *Change*.
# Choose *Create with shared configuration > Select*.
# Under Create project with shared configuration, select the project from which you want your new project to share its configuration.
# Select *Create*.
{quote}

This, however, does not reflect the current behavior. Instead, users should now be expanding the *Advanced* menu and checking the *"Share settings with an existing project"* checkbox, as represented in the image below.
 *  !Screen Shot 2018-09-03 at 4.36.59 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Update "Create a project in your new Jira experience" Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As a result of the Agility projects use, REST API endpoints are providing unexpected results for the customer: 
* when trying to choose an issue type (screenshot), I will see more than one issue type *Story*.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Access a third party app interface on your Jira cloud site where they ask you to choose from a list of issue types (in the screenshot it is third party app Zephyr)
*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* See only one Story issue type
* Or being able to differentiate between issue types. 

h3. Actual Results
* Seeing duplicate of issue types.
 
h3. Notes
* This result is not expected for the UI user.
* This result is confusing for the UI user.
* This result is expected from our side, since we know that each Agility project created will have a separate issue type *Story* . 

h6. Extra note: 
* In the same context, this happens also if we use the workflow REST API endpoint: [Get All Workflows Endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-workflow-get]
fields.summary: Multiple issues types called Story when having Agility projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The new layout for the *Create Issue* screen in JIRA includes the *Import Issues* button by default.
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-03 at 15.19.54.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the admin of the site to *enable or disable* the button in the *Create Issue* screen

h3. Why this is important
* Admins do not want every user to have the ability to import issues by default
* No actual need for users who are not involved in any form of importing issues to a specific project
 
h3. Workaround 
No available workaround as of now
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud: Option to Enable / Disable the "Import Issues" button

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to add any type of custom field to track how many comments exist in issues in Jira Cloud.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a custom field that counts how many comments exist in a Jira Issue.

h3. Why this is important

This would make so users can generate reports based on how many comments were added to an issue and it would make it easier to visualize this information when viewing issues.

It's important for users that use the number of comments as a metric in their business.
 
h3. Workaround 
Use either the third-party app ScriptRunner or Automation Lite for Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: Add a custom field comment counter to Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sometimes the button to reorder status doesn't work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the *Statuses*;
# Click in the arrows to reorder any of the existing statuses
 !statuses.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The status is correctly reordered.

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes the button do nothing - You click on the arrows to move the status up and down, but nothing happens.

h3. Notes
The problem is intermittent and happens with any status (custom or system)

h3.Workaround
Try again - As the problem is intermittent, it may be necessary to click on the button multiple times.

Update: in my previous tests, the most reliable results was when clicking on the arrow button *5 times* in a row before letting the page load.
fields.summary: Sometimes the option to reorder statuses doesn't work as expected

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 10 Dec 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi Everyone,

I want to provide a quick update for this topic. this feature, *rollup time tracking from sub-task to the parent issue*, is being under consideration to be prioritised in the next couple of months. we will keep you posted with the updates. I know this has taken a while to build out, but rebuilding Jira issues is no small feat, so we very much appreciate your patience on this.

In the meantime, you can opt out of this new issue experience via your *Personal Settings* > *Jira Labs section* will have a 'new issue view' toggle to turn it on or off. We will not be disabling this opt-out option until we have rebuilt all the key features of the Jira issues experience you have come to know and love.

Regards,

Atlassian
{panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a task and set 1h of time spent. 
# Create a subtask and set 10m of time spent
# Log work on the sub-task

h3. Expected Results
* the task *Time Tracking* panel shows 1h 10m.
* Sub-task log work is visible in the parent
*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* the task *Time Tracking* panel shows 1h (does not include sub-task)
* The option to include sub-task does not show up.
* The log work made in the sub-task does not appear in the parent's view


h3.Workaround

If you are using Jira Software, you can disable the new issue view using the steps described below:

# Click your user's avatar at the bottom-left of your screen
# Click on *Settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view*, click the green button to disable the new issue view. It will become gray when it is disabled.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks no longer have their time tracked on the parent issue for the new Full View Issue experience
